comment.author: 23213986@N05
comment._content:
The "light" is nothing more than an overexposure or chemical burn from mishandling of the film, or a result of irregularities in the manufacturing of the color film itself, when both manufacturing and developing techniques for color film were new and far from perfected.

If you've ever seen what happens when a movie projector bulb overheats (or the film is played too many times back-to-back) and watched the film start to melt on-screen, you'd recognize this phenomenon right away.
